meanings.definition: To make someone look or feel more attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: She wore a flattering dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The new haircut was very flattering on her.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the mirror must be flattering him today.
meanings.sent4: The soft lighting in the room was flattering to her complexion.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting skillfully flattered the subject's features.

meanings.definition: Showing someone in a favorable light.
meanings.sent1: The flattering photo made her smile.
meanings.sent2: Her flattering words boosted his confidence.
meanings.sent3: The flattering angle of the camera made him look taller.
meanings.sent4: The flattering review highlighted her strengths.
meanings.sent5: The flattering filter on the photo softened her features.

meanings.sent1: She kept flattering him with compliments all evening.
meanings.sent2: He flattered her with words of admiration.
meanings.sent3: The waiter flattered the chef by praising the delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The politician flattered the audience with promises of change.
meanings.sent5: Her friends flattered her with a surprise party for her birthday.
